groovy.stream

Class Stream<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • groovy.stream.Stream<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of each element returned from the Stream.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>, Iterator<T>

    public class Stream<T>
extends Object
implements Iterator<T>, Iterable<T>

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public Stream<T> filter(Closure<Boolean> predicate)
        Filter the current stream, passing each element through a predicate filter. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .filter { it % 2 == 1 }
                .collect() == [ 1, 3 ]
        Parameters:
        predicate - A single parameter closure to pass the element through, returning true if the element is to be included.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a FilteringIterator

      • filterWithIndex

        public Stream<T> filterWithIndex(Closure<Boolean> predicate)
        Filter the current stream, passing each element and it's index through a predicate filter. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .filterWithIndex { it, index -> index % 2 == 1 }
                .collect() == [ 2 ]
        Parameters:
        predicate - A two parameter closure, the first parameter being the element in the Stream, the second the index (starting at 0).
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a FilteringIterator

      • concat

        public Stream<T> concat(Iterator<? extends T> other)
        Returns a new Stream which will iterate the elements in the current Stream, followed by the elements in the other Stream. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def a = Stream.from( 1..3 )
   def b = Stream.from( 'a'..'c' )

   assert a.concat( b ).collect() == [ 1, 2, 3, 'a', 'b', 'c' ]
        Parameters:
        other - The Stream to iterate after the current one is exhausted.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a ConcatenationIterator

      • skip

        public Stream<T> skip(int n)
        Skip n elements. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..10 )
                .skip( 6 ).collect() == [ 7, 8, 9, 10 ]
        Parameters:
        n - the number of elements to skip
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a SkipIterator

      • flatMap

        public <U> Stream<U> flatMap(Closure<? extends Collection<U>> map)
        Takes a Closure that returns a Collection. Each element in this Collection is passed on in turn, before the next element is fetched from upstream, and the Closure executed again. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .flatMap { [ it ] * it }
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3 ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        map - A single parameter closure to pass the element through, returning a new Collection of elements to iterate.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a FlatMapIterator

      • flatMapWithIndex

        public <U> Stream<U> flatMapWithIndex(Closure<? extends Collection<U>> map)
        Takes a Closure that returns a Collection. Each element in this Collection is passed on in turn, before the next element is fetched from upstream, and the Closure executed again. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .flatMapWithIndex { it, index -> [ it ] * index }
                .collect() == [ 2, 3, 3 ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        map - A two parameter closure to pass the element and it's index through, returning a new Collection of elements to iterate.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a FlatMapIterator

      • tap

        public Stream<T> tap(Closure<Void> output)
        Inspect every value in the Stream and pass it on. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def list = []
   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .tap { list << it }
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
   assert list == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
        Parameters:
        output - The Closure to be called for every element
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TapIterator

      • tapEvery

        public Stream<T> tapEvery(int n,
                          Closure<Void> output)
        Inspect the every nth value in the Stream and pass it on. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def list = []
   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .tapEvery( 2 ) { list << it }
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
   assert list == [ 2 ]
        Parameters:
        n - the elements to inspect
        output - The Closure to be called for every nth element
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TapIterator

      • tapWithIndex

        public Stream<T> tapWithIndex(Closure<Void> output)
        Inspect every value in the Stream with its index and pass it on. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def list = []
   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .tapWithIndex { it, idx -> list << [ (it):idx ] }
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
   assert list == [ [ 1:0 ], [ 2:1 ], [ 3:2 ] ]
        Parameters:
        output - The closure to call for each element in the Stream.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TapIterator

      • tapEveryWithIndex

        public Stream<T> tapEveryWithIndex(int n,
                                   Closure<Void> output)
        Inspect the every nth value in the Stream with its index and pass it on. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def list = []
   assert Stream.from( 1..3 )
                .tapEveryWithIndex( 2 ) { it, index -> list << [ (it):index ] }
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
   assert list == [ [2:1] ]
        Parameters:
        n - the elements to inspect
        output - The Closure to be called for every nth element
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TapIterator

      • map

        public <U> Stream<U> map(Closure<U> map)
        Maps the elements of a Stream to a new value as they are requested. Each element is passed in to a one arg closure, and the result of the Closure is returned as the next element in the Stream. The element is also set as the delegate of the Closure, so you can access map entries by name. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( x:1..3, y:'a'..'c' )
                .map { "$x:$y" }
                .collect() == [ "1:a", "1:b", "1:c",
                                "2:a", "2:b", "2:c",
                                "3:a", "3:b", "3:c" ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        map - The transforming Closure.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TransformingIterator

      • mapWithIndex

        public <U> Stream<U> mapWithIndex(Closure<U> map)
        Maps the elements of a Stream to a new value as they are requested. Each element plus an index is passed in to a two arg closure, and the result of the Closure is returned as the next element in the Stream. The element is also set as the delegate of the Closure, so you can access map entries by name. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( x:1..3, y:'a'..'c' )
                .mapWithIndex { it, idx -> "${x}:${it.y}:${idx}" }
                .collect() == [ "1:a:0", "1:b:1", "1:c:2",
                                "2:a:3", "2:b:4", "2:c:5",
                                "3:a:6", "3:b:7", "3:c:8" ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        map - The transforming Closure.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a TransformingIterator

      • until

        public Stream<T> until(Closure<Boolean> predicate)
        Parameters:
        predicate - The Closure that stops the Stream when it returns true.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an UntilIterator

      • untilWithIndex

        public Stream<T> untilWithIndex(Closure<Boolean> predicate)
        Parameters:
        predicate - The Closure that stops the Stream when it returns true.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an UntilIterator

      • collate

        public Stream<Collection<T>> collate(int size)
        Groups a the elements of a Stream into groups of length size. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..9 )
                .collate( 4 )
                .collect() == [ [ 1, 2, 3, 4 ], [ 5, 6, 7, 8 ], [ 9 ] ]
        Parameters:
        size - the size of each collated group
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an CollatingIterator

      • collate

        public Stream<Collection<T>> collate(int size,
                                     boolean keepRemainder)
        Groups a the elements of a Stream into groups of length size. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..9 )
                .collate( 4, false )
                .collect() == [ [ 1, 2, 3, 4 ], [ 5, 6, 7, 8 ] ]
        Parameters:
        size - the size of each collated group
        keepRemainder - Should any remaining objects be returned at the end
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an CollatingIterator

      • collate

        public Stream<Collection<T>> collate(int size,
                                     int step)
        Groups a the elements of a Stream into groups of length size using a step-size of step. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..9 )
                .collate( 4, 1 )
                .collect() == [ [ 1, 2, 3, 4 ],
                                [ 2, 3, 4, 5 ],
                                [ 3, 4, 5, 6 ],
                                [ 4, 5, 6, 7 ],
                                [ 5, 6, 7, 8 ],
                                [ 6, 7, 8, 9 ],
                                [ 7, 8, 9 ],
                                [ 8, 9 ],
                                [ 9 ] ]
        Parameters:
        size - the size of each collated group
        step - How many to increment the window by each turn
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an CollatingIterator

      • collate

        public Stream<Collection<T>> collate(int size,
                                     int step,
                                     boolean keepRemainder)
        Groups a the elements of a Stream into groups of length size using a step-size of step. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..9 )
                .collate( 4, 1, false )
                .collect() == [ [ 1, 2, 3, 4 ],
                                [ 2, 3, 4, 5 ],
                                [ 3, 4, 5, 6 ],
                                [ 4, 5, 6, 7 ],
                                [ 5, 6, 7, 8 ],
                                [ 6, 7, 8, 9 ] ]
        Parameters:
        size - the size of each collated group
        step - How many to increment the window by each turn
        keepRemainder - Should any remaining objects be returned at the end
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping an CollatingIterator

      • zip

        public <U,V> Stream<V> zip(Iterator<U> other,
                           Closure<V> map)
        Takes another Iterator or Stream and calls the two arg Closure to zip the two together. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def numbers = Stream.from 1..3
   def letters = Stream.from 'a'..'d'
  
   assert numbers.zip( letters ) { n, l -> "$n:$l" }
                .collect() == [ "1:a", "2:b", "3:c" ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the secondary Stream.
        V - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Iterator
        map - The 2 arg Closure to call with each next element from the Stream
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a ZipIterator

      • zipWithIndex

        public <U,V> Stream<V> zipWithIndex(Iterator<U> other,
                                    Closure<V> map)
        Takes another Iterator or Stream and calls the three arg Closure to zip the two together along with the current index. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   def numbers = Stream.from 1..3
   def letters = Stream.from 'a'..'d'
  
   assert numbers.zipWithIndex( letters ) { n, l, i -> "$n:$l:$i" }
                .collect() == [ "1:a:0", "2:b:1", "3:c:2" ]
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the secondary Stream.
        V - The type of the new Stream.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Iterator
        map - The 3 arg Closure to call with each next element from the Stream and the current stream index
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a ZipIterator

      • take

        public Stream<T> take(int n)
        Limits the Stream to n elements. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( 1..9 )
                .take( 3 )
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
        Parameters:
        n - The number of element to limit the Stream to.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a LimitedIterator

      • from

        public static <K,V> Stream<Map<K,V>> from(Map<K,? extends Iterable<V>> map)
        Construct a Stream from a Map of Iterables. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( a:1..3, b:'a'..'c' )
                .collect() == [ [ a:1, b:'a' ],
                                [ a:1, b:'b' ],
                                [ a:1, b:'c' ],
                                [ a:2, b:'a' ],
                                [ a:2, b:'b' ],
                                [ a:2, b:'c' ],
                                [ a:3, b:'a' ],
                                [ a:3, b:'b' ],
                                [ a:3, b:'c' ] ]
        Type Parameters:
        K - They type of the Map keys.
        V - The type of the Iterable value.
        Parameters:
        map - The map of Iterables.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping a MapIterator.

      • from

        public static <T> Stream<T> from(Stream<T> stream)
        Construct a Stream from another Stream. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( Stream.from( 1..3 ) )
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The other Stream.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping the iterator of the other Stream.

      • from

        public static <T> Stream<T> from(Iterable<T> iterable)
        Construct a Stream from an Iterable. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( [ 1, 2, 3 ] )
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Iterable.
        Parameters:
        iterable - The iterable to iterate.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping the iterable.iterator().

      • from

        public static <T> Stream<T> from(Iterator<T> iterator)
        Construct a Stream from an Iterator. 
           import groovy.stream.*

   assert Stream.from( [ 1, 2, 3 ].iterator() )
                .collect() == [ 1, 2, 3 ]
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Iterator.
        Parameters:
        iterator - The iterator to wrap.
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping the iterator.

      • from

        public static <T> Stream<T> from(T[] array)
        Construct a Stream that iterates every Object in an array. First converts the array to an ArrayList, then wraps the ArrayList.iterator().
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the array.
        Parameters:
        array - An array of Object to iterate
        Returns:
        A new Stream wrapping the iterator for the array as a List.
